intro: Mesembryanthemum dimorphum, commonly known as the two-form ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant produces two distinct leaf forms—one upright and one prostrate—depending on light conditions. It thrives in arid environments and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. Mesembryanthemum dimorphum is also known for its ability to survive extreme drought conditions.
